intro: Catostemma ebracteolatum, commonly known as the slender catostemma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges.
